Dating: 21ST DYNASTY (not before); 21ST DYNASTY ?; 3RD INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after)
Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; FAYENCE; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Shabti of Bakendjehouty (?)
Description: This funerary statuette in greenish faience was discovered at Abydos during the excavations of J. Garstang in 1908-1909. The owner, whose name is difficult to read, was "prophet of Amun". The frontal band tied behind the head could indicate that the statuette dates from the 21st Dynasty or from the 22nd Dynasty.
